intro: Hieracium bruennense, commonly known as the Brunnean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium bruennense is an herbaceous perennial, often found in temperate climates with moderate rainfall.
